SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Premium Brands relative to the peak of Convenience-Oriented in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Premium Brands is to the {left} of the peak of Convenience-Oriented.

EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Health-Conscious} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =50.7?
EVJ.A: At X =50.7,the label with the highest density is {Premium Brands}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Organic Shoppers or Ethical Consumers?
NC.A: {Ethical Consumers} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Convenience-Oriented or Health-Conscious?
NC.A: {Convenience-Oriented} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Budget Shoppers}
